Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to declare dependent child under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Violation_Type: Non-disclosure of a dependent family member
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was paragraph 117(9)(d) of the IRP Regulations properly applied to exclude An Bo Xie from the family class due to non-disclosure?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR), paragraph 117(9)(d)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Mrs. Chen did not declare her first son, An Bo Xie, on her application for permanent residence or at the port of entry, believing he was not a dependent.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: An Bo Xie is excluded from the family class sponsorship due to non-disclosure.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Appeal to sponsor An Bo Xie under the family class
Crimes.Court_Ruling: The regulation was properly applied; appeal dismissed
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Failure to disclose An Bo Xie as a dependent during the permanent residence application
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Belief that An Bo Xie was not a dependent child at the time of application
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Interpretation and application of paragraph 117(9)(d) of the IRPR
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Timing of declaration and eligibility for examination as a dependent
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of Immigration Appeal Division's decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not a central factor; omission assessed objectively
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Permanent residence application form, port of entry records, testimony regarding knowledge of dependency status
Crimes.Application_Basis: Automatic exclusion from family class if not declared at time of application or landing
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Documentation showing non-disclosure during initial immigration process
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Inclusion of An Bo Xie in family class sponsorship
Crimes.Governing_Rule: A person not declared at the time of permanent residence application cannot be sponsored under the family class
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of documentation declaring An Bo Xie as a dependent
Crimes.Decisional_Body: Federal Court reviewing Immigration Appeal Division decision
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Exclusion of An Bo Xie from immediate family sponsorship pathway
Crimes.Cause_Description: Non-disclosure of a dependent child during the permanent residence application process
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Reliance on official immigration documents and procedural compliance records
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Compliance with disclosure requirements under permanent residency rules
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Regulatory requirement strictly applied regardless of intent
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Immigration Appeal Division, reviewed by Federal Court
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: None raised; facts of non-disclosure undisputed

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Family class sponsorship eligibility based on prior omissions
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Was paragraph 117(9)(d) of the IRP Regulations properly applied to exclude An Bo Xie from the family class?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, paragraph 117(9)(d)
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Appeal of Immigration Appeal Division decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not central; focus on legal effect of non-disclosure
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Immigration application records, port of entry documentation
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Attempt to sponsor previously undeclared child
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Non-disclosure at time of permanent residence application
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Immigration Appeal Division, subject to Federal Court review
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to include An Bo Xie in original application
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Correctness or reasonableness of statutory interpretation
Crimes.Application_Factor: Eligibility for sponsorship under family class rules
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: An Bo Xie remains excluded from family class sponsorship
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to declare dependent child during permanent residency application
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process followed correctly; no breach alleged
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that non-disclosure was unintentional and should not bar sponsorship
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and completeness of family member declaration
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Ineligibility for sponsorship under family class due to non-disclosure
